injuries.shortComment: Zubac has been placed in the league's health and safety protocols, Ohm Youngmisuk of ESPN.com reports.
injuries.longComment: It's not yet clear whether Zubac has tested positive for COVID-19 or when he'll be able to rejoin the team. In his absence, Serge Ibaka and Justise Winslow should see most of the frontcourt duties for the Clippers.

injuries.shortComment: Batum (ankle) will not play Friday against Toronto,  Tomer Azarly of ClutchPoints reports.
injuries.longComment: Batum is still nursing a sprained right ankle that will cost him a third straight contest. With the Clippers entering a back-to-back, there's a good chance the veteran will miss Saturday's game at Brooklyn, as well.

injuries.shortComment: Wright was placed in the league's health and safety protocols Monday, Andrew Greif of the Los Angeles Times reports.
injuries.longComment: The Clippers signed Wright to a 10-day hardship contract Dec. 21, but he made just one brief appearance during his stint in the NBA. Once he clears protocols, he will likely head back to the G League, which doesn't resume play until Jan. 4.

injuries.shortComment: Hartenstein (ankle) remains without a timetable for his return, Ohm Youngmisuk of ESPN.com reports
injuries.longComment: The center has missed the past two games for the Clippers and appears set to miss at least a few more showings as he remains sidelined with an ankle injury. Serge Ibaka should continue to see more usage with the 23-year-old on the bench.

injuries.shortComment: Scrubb entered the NBA's health and safety protocols Sunday, Tim Bontemps of ESPN.com reports.
injuries.longComment: Scrubb is the third member of the Clippers to enter the league's COVID-19 protocols. The 21-year-old has played in just nine games so far this season and is averaging just six minutes in those appearances.

injuries.shortComment: George suffered a torn ligament in his right elbow and will be re-evaluated in 3-4 weeks, Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: George just returned to play two games following a five-game absence due to an injury in the same elbow, which has apparently been aggravated. In his absence, Luke Kennard, Brandon Boston and Terance Mann should see increased run. Reggie Jackson (COVID-19 protocols) and Eric Bledsoe also figure to take on extra responsibilities.

injuries.shortComment: Preston (foot) underwent surgery Thursday and is expected to miss a significant part of the season, Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: Preston was the 33rd pick in this year's draft. It's not clear exactly when he'll return, but when he does, it might be hard for him to crack the rotation.

injuries.shortComment: Leonard (knee) is ahead of schedule in his recovery from a torn ACL, Farbod Esnaashari of Sports Illustrated reports.
injuries.longComment: The Clippers remain cautiously optimistic about the odds of Leonard returning during the regular season. He may return to practice around March or April if things go well, but that's far from a guarantee. Ultimately, fantasy managers can avoid Leonard in almost every league, though if it's a deep league with two IR spots, there's some justification for taking the risk.
